data.title: Bangalore Metro Phase 3 – Information, Route Maps, Tenders & Updates
data.meta_description: 105.55 km Bangalore Metro Phase 3 project is in the planning stage with multiple routes being explored in its DPR to connect Bengaluru's neighborhoods & suburbs

Phase 3 Information

Bangalore (Namma) Metro’s Phase 3 project is currently in the proposal stage with two elevated routes totaling 44.65 km planned in western Bengaluru, Karnataka. The project is currently awaiting the Central Government Cabinet’s approval.

Bangalore Metro’s Phase 3 has been on the drawing board with 105.55 km of routes being explored since 2015. Pre-feasibility and techno-economic feasibility studies by RITES and BMRCL were prepared in 2016. Karnataka’s state government approved the preparation of the project’s detailed project report (DPR) in February 2018 and the work for it was assigned to RITES in July 2020.

Construction on Bangalore Metro’s Phase 3 with 2 lines is expected to begin in 2026 and end in early 2030s. Another 37 km new corridor connecting Hebbal and Sarjapura will be taken up under Bangalore Metro’s Phase 3A project.

Phase 3’s Estimated Cost: Rs. 15,611 crore (Pending Route Finalization & Approval)

BMRCL’s Current Phase 3 Deadline: Not Finalized

My Completion Estimate: 2032 (no sooner, if approved by Central Government in 2024)

Phase 3 Lines (Finalized)

Orange Line: Kempapura – JP Nagar 4th Phase

Length: 32.15 km

Type: Elevated

Number of Stations: 22

Station Names: Kempapura, Hebbal, Nagashetty Halli, BEL Circle, Muthyalanagar, Peenya, Kanteerava Nagar, Freedom Fighter’s Colony, Chowdeshwari Nagar, Sumanahalli Cross, BDA Complex Nagarbhavi, Papireddy Palya, Vinayaka Layout, Nagarbhavi Circle, Mysuru Road, Dwaraka Nagar, Hosakerehalli, Kamakya Junction, Kadirenahalli, JP Nagar, JP Nagar 5th Phase and JP Nagar 4th Phase

Silver Line: Kadabagare – Hosahalli

Length: 12.5 km

Type: Elevated

Number of Stations: 9

Station Names: Kadabagare, Kamath Layout, Byadarahalli, Herohalli, Anjana Nagar Sumanahalli Cross, Kamakshi Palya, KHB Colony and Hosahalli

Note: Official line colors have not been announced.

Old Plan (Lines Not Being Built)

Various metro route proposals have been announced in the last decade. The following are some of them. These might be included or built in some form in later phases.

Carmelaram – Yelahanka (37 km)

Marathahalli – Hosakerehalli (21 km)

Silkboard – KR Puram – Hebbal

Note: The 18 km Silkboard – KR Puram section (view info & DPR) has been fast-tracked and allocated to Phase 2A. In March 2017, the Karnataka Government’s cabinet approved its DPR.

Nagavara – Airport (23 km)

Note: In May 2017, the airport line’s route was finalized via RK Hegde Nagar – Jakkur – Yelahanka – see info here. In 2018, it was decided to be developed under Phase 2B as an extension of the Silkboard – KR Puram line instead.

JP Nagar to K R Puram via Hebbal

Magadi Road Toll Gate to Kadabagere

Gottigere to Basavapura

RK Hegde Nagar to Aerospace Park

Kogilu Cross to Rajanukunte

Bommasandra to Attibele

Iblur to Carmelaram
